history.content: Waitlists are processed in order during the adjustment period for both EE and CS. https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

children.subject:
Yep! Please read the entire policy.

This is the policy for lower-div CS courses:

As soon as all undergraduate students have had their Phase II appointment, no seats will continue to be held for students with particular majors. Similarly, juniors and senior L&S students will also be able to be admitted to these classes at this time. Since now the waitlist will be processed in order, students with other majors and L&S juniors and seniors who used Phase I and Phase II to prioritize these classes will be enrolled before EECS and undeclared L&S students who wait until open enrollment to sign up for these classes.

NOTE: Unless Cal Central does not ask for DIS and/or LAB sections to be chosen, students will need for there to be space in both the lecture and the secondary sections they choose to waitlist before being enrolled.

And for upper-div CS courses:

Once Phase II is over (i.e. mid-August and mid-January for Fall and Spring semesters; also see the Schedule), during open enrollment, any UC student will be enrolled starting from the beginning of the existing waitlist. Neither major status nor class standing will impact enrollment at this point.

NOTE: Unless Cal Central does not ask for DIS sections to be chosen, students will need for there to be space in both the lecture and the secondary sections they choose to waitlist before being enrolled.

I emailed an advisor asking and they replied saying that CS declared/EECS are given priority. Specifically I asked if once staffing is done, will CS declared get off the waitlist first. Your response seems to contradict this.

That may be only if it is during Phase II, not the adjustment period. Sorry, I see I said yes in my 2nd response, but I meant to say yes during the adjustment period, not Phase II. This is consistent with the policy.

Sorry, I'm still confused. I'm a declared student and I got on the waitlist during Phase 2. If I am still on the waitlist when the Adjustment period begins on August 15th, will I no longer get priority over undeclared students?
Is this true even if both the students in question get on the waitlist during Phase 2? In that case, would the undeclared student with #10 on the waitlist be processed before the declared one at #50?
That is what Lydia said above, yes.

Sorry, I'm still confused. I'm a declared student and I got on the waitlist during Phase 2. If I am still on the waitlist when the Adjustment period begins on August 15th, will I no longer get priority over undeclared students?

history.content: For upper div CS classes, are all declared CS/EECS majors processed before non-majors? For example, if an undeclared student is #10 on the waitlist and a declared student is #50, would the declared student still be processed and accepted into the class before the undeclared one?
history.subject: Waitlist Processing
